jobDescription:
Title:  Java Developer  




Position Overview:

A highly skilled Java-J2EE developer with solid object oriented  experience
Should be up-to-date with current technologies and leading design patterns
Participate in a variety of planning and development activities
Responsible for developing prototypes, unit test cases, design artifacts
Ensure that the application components are built to the highest standards across the application lifecycle with a constant focus on process improvement through unit testing automation
Strong knowledge on Core Java, Spring(Core, MVC, JDBC), Hibernate/JDBC/JPA/ORM, JSON 
3+ Year Experience in Java (Core & EE,Spring, JMS,Junit)
Must have experience and in-depth knowledge of SQL and RDBMS, should be able to write and understand SQL queries, stored procedure, index and triggers. MySql experience is a plus 
Professional written and verbal communication skills and demonstrated ability to work in geographically dispersed teams that focus on high accountability of ownership.
Good analytical, debugging and problem solving skills.
Experience working in a fast paced, delivery oriented financial services area using agile practices, coupled with regulatory and digital transformation established deadlines
Experience with AWS is a plus
Minimum of 4 years Java development experience
 

Must Have:

Core Java
custom SQL programming
MySQL
Spring Boot
 

Nice to Have:

Ability to work independently.
Ability to work with a team. Attention to detail. May work under pressure at times
Achieved AWS Cloud certification
Analytical and Problem Solving Skills
 

Second role:

Title:    Software Engineer 

Responsibilities:

Develop microservices using Java, Spring Boot, Angular, or other programming languages, adhering to industry best practices and The Company's coding standards.
Develop and execute unit, component and integration tests, using Cypress and/or Cucumber, to verify the engineering work meets requirements
Document design decisions, design patterns, and implementation details related to the engineering work
Software development adhering to SDLC including requirements discovery, design, verification, product delivery and maintenance
Execution of manual test procedures
Troubleshooting of failed tests or other software bugs
Participates in Agile ceremonies as a member of a scrum team
